required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Dietary Supplemental Fish Oil in Alleviating Health Hazards Associated With Air Pollution
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Dietary Supplementation With Fish Oil in Alleviating Cardiopulmonary Hazards Associated With Air Pollution

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate whether dietary supplementation with fish oil can protect against the cardiopulmonary alterations linked to air pollution

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators conduct a randomized controlled trial among 70 healthy college students in Shanghai, China. These students fulfilling the recruitment criteria will be randomly divided into two parallel groups to receive either fish oil [marine-derived n-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFA)] or sunflower seed oil. Participants in fish oil group receive 2.5 g/day (two 1.25-g capsules daily) in divided doses. The sunflower seed oil capsules are identical. All interventions started at 7:30 a.m.to avoid issues related to diurnal variation. Health endpoints, including blood pressure, fractional exhaled nitric oxide and pulmonary function were evaluated and biological samples such as morning urine, fast blood, saliva sample,buccal cells and skin tape stripping will be collected at week 1 before supplemenatation, and week 8, week 10, week 12 as well as week 14 during the supplementation phase.The investigators measure personal real-time exposure to PM2.5 and personal temperature and relative humidity.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants are randomly assigned to two parallel groups at enrollment using a random-number table. And the investigators randomly assign the two groups in a double-blind fashion receive either ﬁsh oil or sunflower seed oil for 4 months.
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Biomarkers of Antioxidant Activity-Total Antioxidant Capacity (TAC) and Superoxide Dismutase (SOD)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples are obtained at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months of intervention.
primary_outcome.description: Peripheral blood samples (5 ml) were drawn, separated into serum, and stored at -80 ℃ within 30 minutes. We measure 2 biomarkers of antioxidant activity, including TAC and SOD. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

primary_outcome.measure: Biomarkers of Inflammation-Interleukin-6 (IL-6) and Tumour Necrosis Factor-α (TNF-α)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples are obtained at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months of intervention.
primary_outcome.description: 2 inflammatory biomarkers in our study including IL-6 and TNF-α are measured. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples are obtained at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months of intervention.
primary_outcome.description: We measure vWF level in serum, one of the measured cogulation biomarkers in our study. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

primary_outcome.measure: Biomarkers of Endothelial Function and Stress Hormone
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples are obtained at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months of intervention.
primary_outcome.description: We measure endothelial function biomarkers, including E-selectin and endothelial nitric oxide synthase (eNOS), and 4 stress hormones, including corticotropin releasing hormone (CRH), adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), cortisol and serotonin. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples are obtained at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months of intervention.
primary_outcome.description: We measure ET-1 level in serum, an endothelial function biomarker. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples are obtained at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months of intervention.
primary_outcome.description: We measure the serum level of fibrinogen, one of the two measured cogulation biomarkers in our study. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples are obtained at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months of intervention.
primary_outcome.description: The serum levels of hs-CRP are measured. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

primary_outcome.measure: Oxidized Low Density Lipoprotein (Ox-LDL)-an Oxidative Stress Biomarker
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples are obtained at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months of intervention.
primary_outcome.description: Peripheral blood samples (5 ml) were drawn, separated into serum, and stored at -80 ℃ within 30 minutes. We measure the serum level of ox-LDL. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

primary_outcome.measure: Glutathione Peroxidase (GSH-Px)-a Biomarker of Antioxidant Activity
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples are obtained at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months of intervention.
primary_outcome.description: Peripheral blood samples (5 ml) were drawn, separated into serum, and stored at -80 ℃ within 30 minutes. We also measure GSH-Px. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

primary_outcome.measure: Serum Level of Lipid Peroxidation (LPO)-a Biomarker of Oxdative Stress
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples are obtained at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months of intervention.
primary_outcome.description: Peripheral blood samples (5 ml) were drawn, separated into serum, and stored at -80 ℃ within 30 minutes. We measure the serum level of LPO. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood pressure are measured at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months of intervention.
secondary_outcome.description: After sitting in a quiet room for at least 5 min, participants had their left upper arm blood pressure measured by trained technicians using an electronic sphygmomanometer at least three times with 3-min minimum intervals between measurements. The second and third sets of readings were averaged to obtain systolic BP (SBP) and diastolic BP (DBP). If the differences among the three measurements were bigger than 5 mmHg, a new round of measurements was arranged. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples are obtained at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months of intervention.
secondary_outcome.description: The biomarker of insulin resistance is measured, calculated by fasting glucose and fasting insulin using the formula of [fasting insulin (mU/L) × fasting glucose (mmol/L)]/22.5. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Skin samplings are obtained at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months of intervention.
secondary_outcome.description: 2 infammation biomarkers from skin samplings are measured, including interleukin-1 Alpha (IL-1α) and Interleukin-1 receptor antagonist (IL-1Rα). The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Skin samplings are obtained at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months.
secondary_outcome.description: oxidative stress biomarker in skin samplings includes carbonyl protein. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Lung Function-Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) and Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Lung function is measured at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months of intervention.
secondary_outcome.description: Indicators of lung function include forced vital capacity (FVC) and andforced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1). The values in the Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Lung function is measured at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months of intervention.
secondary_outcome.description: Additional indicator of lung function includes peak expiratory flow (PEF). The values in the Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Skin samplings are obtained at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months.
secondary_outcome.description: we measure TAC level, an antioxidant biomarker in skin samplings. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Skin samplings are obtained at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months.
secondary_outcome.description: we measure another skin antioxidant biomarker-GSH, . The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

arm_group.description: This group receive 2.5 g/day (two 1.25-g capsules daily) of fish oil (marine-derived n-3 PUFA) for 4 consecutive months.
This group receive 2.5 g/day (two 1.25-g capsules daily) of placebo (sunflower seed oil) for 4 consecutive months.

intervention.description: Participants of this randomized double-blind placebo-controlled trial include 70 healthy Chinese adults. The investigators randomly assign participants to two parallel groups at baseline using a random-number table. Compliance is determined by directly observed supplement intake. Participants in fish oil group are assigned to receive 2.5 g/day in divided doses. Each capsule contains 60% n-3 PUFA [24% docosahexanoic acid (C22:6 n-3 DHA) and 36% eicosapentaenoic acid (C20:5 n-3 EPA)].

Participants of this randomized double-blind placebo-controlled trial include 70 healthy Chinese adults. The investigators randomly assign participants to two parallel groups at baseline using a random-number table. Compliance is determined by directly observed supplement intake. Participants in sunflower seed oil group receive 2.5 g/day in divided doses, and the capsules are identical as the fish oil capsules.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Equal to or older than 18 years old.
- No history of smoking and alcohol addiction.
- No chronic diseases or respiratory or allergic diseases,such as hypertension,diabetes,chronic obstructive pulmonary disease,other respiratory/cardiovascular diseases, asthma, rhinitis or other allergic diseases reported by volunteers.
- No allergies to n-3 PUFA or fish.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current smokers or ever smokers
- Chronic drug use due on cardiovascular or respiratory diseases
- Participants are taking fish oil,anti-inflammatory drugs, or antioxidant supplements (such as vitamin C or vitamin E)

overall_official.affiliation: School of Public Health, Fudan University

facility.name: Department of Environmental Health, School of Public Health, Fudan University

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Recruitment was conducted on Agust, 2017 in Fenglin Campus, Fudan University. A total of 93 participants were assessed for eligibility and 70 of them were finally recruited.

group.title: Fish Oil Supplementation
group.description: This group receive 2.5 g/day (two 1.25-g capsules daily) of fish oil (marine-derived n-3 PUFA) for 4 consecutive months. Fish oil supplementation: Participants of this randomized double-blind placebo-controlled trial include 70 healthy Chinese adults. The investigators randomly assign participants to two parallel groups at baseline using a random-number table. Compliance is determined by directly observed supplement intake. Participants in fish oil group are assigned to receive 2.5 g/day in divided doses. Each capsule contains 60% n-3 PUFA [24% docosahexanoic acid (C22:6 n-3 DHA) and 36% eicosapentaenoic acid (C20:5 n-3 EPA)].

group.title: Sunflower Seed Oil Supplementation
group.description: This group receive 2.5 g/day (two 1.25-g capsules daily) of placebo (sunflower seed oil) for 4 consecutive months. Sunflower seed oil supplementation: Participants of this randomized double-blind placebo-controlled trial include 70 healthy Chinese adults. The investigators randomly assign participants to two parallel groups at baseline using a random-number table. Compliance is determined by directly observed supplement intake. Participants in sunflower seed oil group receive 2.5 g/day in divided doses, and the capsules are identical as the fish oil capsules. Each capsule containes 14.4% palmitic acid (C16:0), 16.0% oleic acid (C18:1 n-9), and 57.6% linoleic acid (C18:2 n-6).

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Physical activity
measure.description: Physical activity: mild, 90–180 minutes/week; moderate, 180–360 minutes/week; and vigorous, >360 minutes/week.

Participants in fish oil group are assigned to receive 2.5 g/day in divided doses. Each capsule contains 60% n-3 PUFA [24% docosahexanoic acid (C22:6 n-3 DHA) and 36% eicosapentaenoic acid (C20:5 n-3 EPA)].

group.title: Sunflower Seed Oil Supplementation
group.description: This group receive 2.5 g/day (two 1.25-g capsules daily) of placebo (sunflower seed oil) for 4 consecutive months. Sunflower seed oil supplementation: Participants of this randomized double-blind placebo-controlled trial include 70 healthy Chinese adults. The investigators randomly assign participants to two parallel groups at baseline using a random-number table. Compliance is determined by directly observed supplement intake. Participants in sunflower seed oil group receive 2.5 g/day in divided doses, and the capsules are identical as the fish oil capsules. Each capsule containes 14.4% palmitic acid (C16:0), 16.0% oleic acid (C18:1 n-9), and 57.6% linoleic acid (C18:2 n-6).

measure.title: Oxidized Low Density Lipoprotein (Ox-LDL)-an Oxidative Stress Biomarker
measure.description: Peripheral blood samples (5 ml) were drawn, separated into serum, and stored at -80 ℃ within 30 minutes. We measure the serum level of ox-LDL. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

outcome.title: Glutathione Peroxidase (GSH-Px)-a Biomarker of Antioxidant Activity
outcome.description: Peripheral blood samples (5 ml) were drawn, separated into serum, and stored at -80 ℃ within 30 minutes. We also measure GSH-Px. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples are obtained at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months of intervention.

group.title: Fish Oil Supplementation
group.description: This group receive 2.5 g/day (two 1.25-g capsules daily) of fish oil (marine-derived n-3 PUFA) for 4 consecutive months. Fish oil supplementation: Participants of this randomized double-blind placebo-controlled trial include 70 healthy Chinese adults. The investigators randomly assign participants to two parallel groups at baseline using a random-number table. Compliance is determined by directly observed supplement intake. Participants in fish oil group are assigned to receive 2.5 g/day in divided doses. Each capsule contains 60% n-3 PUFA [24% docosahexanoic acid (C22:6 n-3 DHA) and 36% eicosapentaenoic acid (C20:5 n-3 EPA)].

group.description: This group receive 2.5 g/day (two 1.25-g capsules daily) of placebo (sunflower seed oil) for 4 consecutive months. Sunflower seed oil supplementation: Participants of this randomized double-blind placebo-controlled trial include 70 healthy Chinese adults. The investigators randomly assign participants to two parallel groups at baseline using a random-number table. Compliance is determined by directly observed supplement intake. Participants in sunflower seed oil group receive 2.5 g/day in divided doses, and the capsules are identical as the fish oil capsules. Each capsule containes 14.4% palmitic acid (C16:0), 16.0% oleic acid (C18:1 n-9), and 57.6% linoleic acid (C18:2 n-6).

measure.title: Glutathione Peroxidase (GSH-Px)-a Biomarker of Antioxidant Activity
measure.description: Peripheral blood samples (5 ml) were drawn, separated into serum, and stored at -80 ℃ within 30 minutes. We also measure GSH-Px. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

outcome.title: Serum Level of Lipid Peroxidation (LPO)-a Biomarker of Oxdative Stress
outcome.description: Peripheral blood samples (5 ml) were drawn, separated into serum, and stored at -80 ℃ within 30 minutes. We measure the serum level of LPO. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples are obtained at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months of intervention.

group.title: Fish Oil Supplementation
group.description: This group receive 2.5 g/day (two 1.25-g capsules daily) of fish oil (marine-derived n-3 PUFA) for 4 consecutive months. Fish oil supplementation: Participants of this randomized double-blind placebo-controlled trial include 70 healthy Chinese adults. The investigators randomly assign participants to two parallel groups at baseline using a random-number table. Compliance is determined by directly observed supplement intake. Participants in fish oil group are assigned to receive 2.5 g/day in divided doses. Each capsule contains 60% n-3 PUFA [24% docosahexanoic acid (C22:6 n-3 DHA) and 36% eicosapentaenoic acid (C20:5 n-3 EPA)].

group.title: Sunflower Seed Oil Supplementation
group.description: This group receive 2.5 g/day (two 1.25-g capsules daily) of placebo (sunflower seed oil) for 4 consecutive months. Sunflower seed oil supplementation: Participants of this randomized double-blind placebo-controlled trial include 70 healthy Chinese adults. The investigators randomly assign participants to two parallel groups at baseline using a random-number table. Compliance is determined by directly observed supplement intake. Participants in sunflower seed oil group receive 2.5 g/day in divided doses, and the capsules are identical as the fish oil capsules. Each capsule containes 14.4% palmitic acid (C16:0), 16.0% oleic acid (C18:1 n-9), and 57.6% linoleic acid (C18:2 n-6).

measure.title: Serum Level of Lipid Peroxidation (LPO)-a Biomarker of Oxdative Stress
measure.description: Peripheral blood samples (5 ml) were drawn, separated into serum, and stored at -80 ℃ within 30 minutes. We measure the serum level of LPO. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

outcome.title: Blood Pressure
outcome.description: After sitting in a quiet room for at least 5 min, participants had their left upper arm blood pressure measured by trained technicians using an electronic sphygmomanometer at least three times with 3-min minimum intervals between measurements. The second and third sets of readings were averaged to obtain systolic BP (SBP) and diastolic BP (DBP). If the differences among the three measurements were bigger than 5 mmHg, a new round of measurements was arranged. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.
outcome.time_frame: Blood pressure are measured at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months of intervention.

group.title: Fish Oil Supplementation
group.description: This group receive 2.5 g/day (two 1.25-g capsules daily) of fish oil (marine-derived n-3 PUFA) for 4 consecutive months. Fish oil supplementation: Participants of this randomized double-blind placebo-controlled trial include 70 healthy Chinese adults. The investigators randomly assign participants to two parallel groups at baseline using a random-number table. Compliance is determined by directly observed supplement intake. Participants in fish oil group are assigned to receive 2.5 g/day in divided doses. Each capsule contains 60% n-3 PUFA [24% docosahexanoic acid (C22:6 n-3 DHA) and 36% eicosapentaenoic acid (C20:5 n-3 EPA)].

group.title: Sunflower Seed Oil Supplementation
group.description: This group receive 2.5 g/day (two 1.25-g capsules daily) of placebo (sunflower seed oil) for 4 consecutive months. Sunflower seed oil supplementation: Participants of this randomized double-blind placebo-controlled trial include 70 healthy Chinese adults. The investigators randomly assign participants to two parallel groups at baseline using a random-number table. Compliance is determined by directly observed supplement intake. Participants in sunflower seed oil group receive 2.5 g/day in divided doses, and the capsules are identical as the fish oil capsules. Each capsule containes 14.4% palmitic acid (C16:0), 16.0% oleic acid (C18:1 n-9), and 57.6% linoleic acid (C18:2 n-6).

measure.title: Blood Pressure
measure.description: After sitting in a quiet room for at least 5 min, participants had their left upper arm blood pressure measured by trained technicians using an electronic sphygmomanometer at least three times with 3-min minimum intervals between measurements. The second and third sets of readings were averaged to obtain systolic BP (SBP) and diastolic BP (DBP). If the differences among the three measurements were bigger than 5 mmHg, a new round of measurements was arranged. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

outcome.title: Insulin Resistance
outcome.description: The biomarker of insulin resistance is measured, calculated by fasting glucose and fasting insulin using the formula of [fasting insulin (mU/L) × fasting glucose (mmol/L)]/22.5. The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples are obtained at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months of intervention.

group.title: Fish Oil Supplementation

Each capsule contains 60% n-3 PUFA [24% docosahexanoic acid (C22:6 n-3 DHA) and 36% eicosapentaenoic acid (C20:5 n-3 EPA)].

The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

outcome.title: Skin Inflammation Biomarkers
outcome.description: 2 infammation biomarkers from skin samplings are measured, including interleukin-1 Alpha (IL-1α) and Interleukin-1 receptor antagonist (IL-1Rα). The values in the following Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.
outcome.time_frame: Skin samplings are obtained at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months of intervention.

outcome.title: Lung Function-Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) and Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1)
outcome.description: Indicators of lung function include forced vital capacity (FVC) and andforced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1). The values in the Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.
outcome.time_frame: Lung function is measured at the end of each round of 4 follow-ups with an interval of 2 weeks in the last 2 months of intervention.

outcome.description: Additional indicator of lung function includes peak expiratory flow (PEF). The values in the Outcome Measure Data Table refer to the means of measurements at 4 follow-ups.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.organization: Department of Environmental Health, School of Public Health, Fudan University
